thread.title_full: Grant Hackett was going off , stabbing knife into chopping block - Yahoo7

author: Sam Hussey
title: Grant Hackett was going off , stabbing knife into chopping block - Yahoo7
text:
Grant Hackett was going off , stabbing knife into chopping block - Yahoo7 Troubled Australian Olympian Grant Hackett has been arrested on the Gold Coast. Close Grant Hackett arrested on the Gold Coast UP NEXT VIDEO Troubled Australian Olympian Grant Hackett has been arrested on the Gold Coast. Source: 7 News Grant Hackett arrested on the Gold Coast 
The former swimming champion was taken to Southport police watchhouse where he flashed his handcuffs to reporters. 
Hackett's father reportedly called police, and said his son had been arrested over "mental health" issues. 
Witnesses claimed that Hackett was "going off" and stabbing a knife into a chopping block before he was arrested outside the Mermaid Waters home. The swimming star was seen handcuffed in the back of a police car #BREAKING Olympian Grant Hackett has been arrested on the Gold Coast. Details to come #7News pic.twitter.com/rNlyi5LbKT — 7 News Perth (@7NewsPerth) February 15, 2017 
Since his retirement from professional swimming in 2008, Hackett's turbulent personal life has been the subject of much discussion. 
In 2011, he trashed his luxury penthouse that he shared with his then-wife Candice Alley. 
The couple separated the following year. 
In 2014, Hackett's mental health again came into question when he lost his son at the Crown Casino in Melbourne. 
The 36-year-old was back in the headlines in April 2016 after he was involved in a mid-flight drunken incident . An admittedly drunken Hackett was pictured in a wheel chair after being taken into custody at Melbourne airport. Source: 7 News 
Hackett came out of retirement in the years leading up to the 2016 Rio Olympics but failed to qualify for the games. 
The former 1500 metre gold medalist was filmed yelling abuse at a fellow passenger on a flight from Adelaide, where the Olympic trials were held, before grabbing the man on the chest in an incident now dubbed 'nipple gate'. 
The flight crew had to restrain the swimming champion and called ahead to Federal Police to meet them at the gate in Melbourne. Grant Hackett's 'nipple tweak' victim not to press charges after in-flight altercation 
“I seriously and genuinely regret my poor behaviour," the swimmer said at the time, admitting that he would undergo anger management counselling. 
"I have stuffed up more than once and am working on these issues. It is embarrassing to hear and read the consequences of my actions." Out of the pool, Hackett has been in the spotlight repeatedly since ending his decorated swimming career. Source: AAP Close Hackett opens up on latest incident UP NEXT VIDEO Disgraced former Olympic swimmer Grant Hackett has admitted to more of the shocking details of his fall from grace. Hackett opens up on latest incident
